definition:
A collection of circles is said to be [*concentric*]{} if they have the
same center. The region formed between two concentric circles is
therefore an annulus.

In the following picture, the gray region is the annulus delimited by
the two black concentric circles.

(-2,-2)(2,2) (0,0)[2]{} (0,0)[0.7]{} (0,0)
